title: Largest galaxy survey yet confirms that the Universe is not clumpy enough

content.abstract: The six-year results from the Dark Energy Survey highlight unresolved tensions in standard cosmological theory. The findings challenge existing models of how matter clumps together in the Universe.

title: Light-powered bacteria become living chemical factories

content.abstract: Engineered Escherichia coli could open the door to more sustainable routes to new drugs and other chemicals. Light-powered synthetic biology enables bacteria to produce complex molecules with unprecedented efficiency.

title: This robot hand detaches and walks by itself

content.abstract: Six-fingered appendage can detach, crawl and manipulate objects. This modular robotic hand represents advances in detachable autonomous manipulation systems.

title: How DeepMind's genome AI could help solve rare disease mysteries

content.abstract: Hackathons using AlphaGenome and other AI models are hunting down the genetic causes of devastating conditions. DeepMind's genomic AI predicts functional genomic tracks at single-base resolution.

title: China is betting on optical computer chips - will they power AI?

content.abstract: Semiconductor chips that process light rather than electricity could boost processing speeds and reduce energy use. China is investing heavily in photonic computing as alternative to traditional silicon.

title: Advancing regulatory variant effect prediction with AlphaGenome

content.abstract: AlphaGenome deep learning model predicts functional genomic tracks at single-base resolution across diverse modalities. Groundbreaking advancement in understanding genetic regulation.

title: How YouTube and Adhesive Tape Are Disrupting Assistive Technology

content.abstract: DIY makers create affordable assistive devices using everyday materials like tape and corrugated plastic, keeping costs under five dollars. Democratizing assistive technology through open-source manufacturing.

title: At Age 25, Wikipedia Refuses to Evolve

content.abstract: Wikipedia's revolutionarily collaborative structure once put it at the vanguard of innovation but now resists updates needed for younger audiences, facing sustainability challenges from AI training on its content.

title: How Clean-Energy Firms Adapt Messaging in the Trump Era

content.abstract: Clean energy companies shift communications strategies from climate-focused messaging to emphasizing affordability, manufacturing domesticity, and grid reliability amid changing federal energy policy priorities.

title: How Norway Accomplished a Near-Total EV Transition

content.abstract: Norway's state secretary discusses how tax exemptions, charging infrastructure development, and policy incentives achieved 97% electric vehicle registration rates while creating new urban mobility challenges.

title: Mapping 6,000 Worlds: The New Era of Exoplanetary Data

content.abstract: NASA's exoplanet catalog surpasses 6,000 confirmed worlds, enabling statistical analysis of planetary formation rates and habitable conditions while newer telescopes promise further discoveries.

title: Can workers compete with machines and stay relevant in the AI era?

content.abstract: AI looks set to be transformative for us all, but it also brings a real risk of job losses and widening social and economic divides. UN analysis of workforce displacement and adaptation strategies.

title: Myanmar crisis deepens five years after coup, as military ballot entrenches repression

content.abstract: Five years post-coup, Myanmar faces escalating violence, mass displacement, and a military-controlled election that UN officials say has deepened repression rather than restored civilian rule.

title: UN watchdog warns Ukraine war remains world's biggest threat to nuclear safety

content.abstract: The fifth year of Ukraine combat looms with continued risks to nuclear power supplies vulnerable to nearby fighting, warns the UN nuclear watchdog head. Nuclear safety remains critical concern.

title: Choose peace over chaos, Guterres urges as he sets out final-year priorities

content.abstract: UN Secretary-General outlined 2026 priorities emphasizing peace, justice, and sustainable development amid rising global tensions and dangerous actions affecting multilateral cooperation.

title: Potential turning point for Gaza as peace plan enters second phase: UN envoy

content.abstract: A UN official described the second phase of Gaza's stabilization plan as offering a potential turning point for the war-ravaged enclave. Diplomatic progress in Middle East peace negotiations.

title: The postal network as economic infrastructure: Evidence from rural small businesses

content.abstract: Research on how postal infrastructure serves as critical economic backbone for rural small businesses, providing essential connectivity and logistical support in underserved areas.

title: Three potential pathways for US-China relations under Trump

content.abstract: Analysis of three potential trajectories for US-China relations under the Trump administration: escalation, managed competition, or strategic accommodation. Implications for global trade and security.

title: What is Trump's 'America First' trade policy agenda?

content.abstract: Comprehensive analysis of the America First trade policy agenda, examining tariff strategies, reshoring incentives, and potential impacts on global supply chains and allied economies.

title: Macroeconomic implications of immigration flows in 2025 and 2026

content.abstract: Updated macroeconomic analysis of immigration flow impacts on GDP growth, labor markets, and fiscal balances in the United States through 2026.

title: Why is the Federal Reserve independent, and what does that mean in practice?

content.abstract: Analysis of Federal Reserve independence: its constitutional basis, practical implications for monetary policy, and current threats from political pressure on interest rate decisions.

title: Can zero-tariff policy rebalance China-Africa trade?

content.abstract: Examination of China's zero-tariff policy toward least developed African nations and whether it can meaningfully rebalance trade deficits and promote African industrialization.

title: Ending Sudan's civil war: A roadmap to peace and reconciliation

content.abstract: Comprehensive peace roadmap addressing Sudan's civil war: ceasefire mechanisms, transitional governance, humanitarian access corridors, and accountability frameworks.

title: The global implications of the US military operation in Venezuela

content.abstract: Analysis of geopolitical ramifications of US military actions in Venezuela, including impacts on Latin American relations, global energy markets, and international norms on sovereignty.

title: Confidence in Trump Dips, and Fewer Now Say They Support His Policies and Plans

content.abstract: Only 27% of Americans support all or most of Trump's policies - a decline from the previous year, with changes concentrated among Republicans. Comprehensive polling data on political sentiment.

title: How Americans view key Trump administration immigration policies

content.abstract: Public opinion on administration immigration initiatives varies, with restrictive measures encountering substantial opposition alongside others receiving broad endorsement. Detailed polling analysis.

title: Teens, Social Media and AI Chatbots 2025

content.abstract: Roughly one-in-five U.S. teens spend almost constant time on TikTok and YouTube. Meanwhile, 64% of teens utilize chatbots, with about three-in-ten doing so daily. Generational technology adoption patterns.

title: Public Trust in Government: 1958-2025

content.abstract: Current confidence measures rank among the lowest recorded across nearly seven decades, declining further from the previous year's 22%. Historic data on trust in democratic institutions.

title: Young Adults and the Future of News

content.abstract: U.S. adults under 30 monitor news less closely than other age cohorts and are more inclined to obtain news from social platforms. Implications for media industry and democratic participation.

title: Religion Holds Steady in America

content.abstract: Research indicates no clear evidence of religious revival among younger adults, with stable patterns across age and gender. Challenges narratives of rapid secularization and counter-revival claims.

title: US formally exits Paris Agreement: Climate implications and global response

content.abstract: Weekly climate news digest covering US Paris Agreement withdrawal, Australian heatwave, US winter storms. Comprehensive analysis of climate policy shifts and extreme weather events.

title: Factcheck: What it really costs to heat a home in the UK with a heat pump

content.abstract: Analysis examining heat pump operating costs, challenging claims that they're more expensive than gas boilers, with expert assessments of efficiency data. Energy transition economics.

title: Will Chinese wind power help or hinder Europe's climate goals?

content.abstract: Guest analysis exploring whether Chinese wind turbine manufacturers entering European markets would support or undermine climate targets through cost competition and supply chain effects.

title: Met Office: A review of the UK's climate in 2025 - warmest and sunniest year on record

content.abstract: Official climate review documenting 2025 as the UK's warmest and sunniest year on record, with attribution analysis showing human-caused climate change increased probability by a factor of 260.

title: Toward the achievement of the price stability target accompanied by wage increases - Bank of Japan

content.abstract: Speech by Governor Kazuo Ueda on Japan's monetary policy direction, price stability targets, and the link between wage increases and sustainable inflation. Key signals for Asian monetary policy.

title: Stablecoins and digital euro driven by digitalisation and geopolitics

content.abstract: Speech by First Deputy Governor Aino Bunge on the intersection of stablecoins, digital euro development, digitalization trends, and geopolitical implications for monetary sovereignty.

title: The future of money - a central bank perspective

content.abstract: ECB Executive Board member Piero Cipollone on the future of money: CBDC development, digital payments infrastructure, and implications for financial stability and monetary sovereignty.

title: Autonomous cars, drones cheerfully obey prompt injection by road sign

content.abstract: Security researchers demonstrate that autonomous vehicles and drones can be manipulated through prompt injection attacks embedded in road signs. Critical vulnerability in AI-powered transportation systems.

title: Finland to end 'uncontrolled human experiment' with ban on youth social media

content.abstract: Finland announces plan to ban social media for minors, describing current unrestricted access as an 'uncontrolled human experiment'. Policy implications for digital regulation globally.

title: US has investigated claims WhatsApp chats aren't private

content.abstract: US government investigation into WhatsApp privacy claims, examining whether end-to-end encryption truly protects user communications. Implications for digital privacy and surveillance.

title: Mobile carriers can get your GPS location

content.abstract: Technical analysis revealing that mobile carriers have capability to access users' precise GPS location data, raising significant privacy and surveillance concerns.

title: Generative AI and Wikipedia editing: What we learned in 2025

content.abstract: Analysis of generative AI's impact on Wikipedia editing practices in 2025. Examines how AI tools are being used in knowledge creation and the challenges of maintaining editorial quality.
